job_title: Account Receivable Clerk in Burlington, ON
pros: The people who work for this organisation are great.
cons: Led to believe that contract work would lead to full time employment. This was not the case.

pros: Great place to work with Godly foundation
cons: Salaries too low with lots of work

pros: International Organisation that addresses local needs. If you want to grow in your career as a leader, this is a place to consider.
cons: Openings are few, so keep your eye on the their webpage.

pros: Wonderful ministry based in Uganda Africa. The opportunity to work with the orphans from Uganda and the adults that traveled with them over the years is very special to me.  I truly enjoyed the relationships I built with the other organizations, churches and people across the US as I promoted and booked the choir. It has been an opportunity I will always treasure.
cons: A lot was expected from the position as it evolved over the years from a  creative relationship building position to more analytical finance driven position.

pros: If you have a passion for helping children in Africa this is a great place. Most co-workers are well meaning.  Love that it is a christian org
cons:
Lack of communication with staff, pay doesn't compete with non-secular jobs. can be a 24/7 job if you let it
Expectations can be gray area and can change without your knowledge.  Management pits one employee against another creates conflict instead of team.

pros: God is worshiped wholeheartedly with words and actions, leadership and mentorship is exercise at the highest level. christ is the center of everthing
cons: opportunity to love God the most

pros: Good place to work ,collaboration between all employees ,flexible working hours and safety work environments ,safety is first motto for organization
cons: Should focus on employee competency developments and training's

pros: Great organisation that helps vulnerable women and children in Uganda. Makes coming to work worthwhile knowing that you are helping someone
cons: Due to limited funding, the Australia team is small and stretched across different roles
Its  not a perfect place just like any other work place
